recipe.name: Crispy Chinese Rice Paper Wrapped Fish (5 Ingredients)
recipe.description: 5 ingredient magic - on a budget! (I get salt and pepper for free ;) ) I saw this on a Chinese cooking show years ago. Make these bite size like I have - or larger by using overlapping pieces of rice paper to encase the fish.
recipeIngredient: 1.1 lb / 600 g   firm white fish fillets ((Note 1))

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the fish into 2"/5cm long x 1"/3cm wide pieces, about 16 pieces. (Note 4)
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the fish into 2"/5cm long x 1"/3cm wide pieces, about 16 pieces. (Note 4)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine Chinese Five Spice Powder, salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine Chinese Five Spice Powder, salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large bowl with hot tap water. Dunk the rice paper into the water for 3 seconds, then transfer it to a work surface. (Note 5)
recipeInstructions.name: Fill a large bowl with hot tap water. Dunk the rice paper into the water for 3 seconds, then transfer it to a work surface. (Note 5)

recipeInstructions.text: Place a piece of fish at the bottom of the rice paper, per the photo below. Top with 2 coriander leaves, then roll up to enclose the fish with the rice paper. Repeat with remaining fish.
recipeInstructions.name: Place a piece of fish at the bottom of the rice paper, per the photo below. Top with 2 coriander leaves, then roll up to enclose the fish with the rice paper. Repeat with remaining fish.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the fish and cook for 2 minutes or until dark golden brown and crispy. Turn and cook the other side. Repeat with remaining fish (I cook them in 2 batches).
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the fish and cook for 2 minutes or until dark golden brown and crispy. Turn and cook the other side. Repeat with remaining fish (I cook them in 2 batches).

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer to a paper lined plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer to a paper lined plate.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, while hot and crispy!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately, while hot and crispy!

review.reviewBody: I made this tonight and it was delicious! I will be serving this at my next dinner party. Thank you

Hi Nagi ... cooked this last night and had similar issues to other reviewers with the rice paper. Pan and oil were certainly hot but the rice paper on the bottom (only one layer thick) essentially disintegrated in the oil. This then allowed the fish etc to ‘escape’. While very tasty, I think perhaps the fish needs to be thinner so when wrapping you get at least 2 layers on the bottom and maybe medium heat rather than medium hot. Will try again and let you know. Going to cook your brilliant Singapore Noodles tonight.
